item.title: Smithing Help Menu!
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

There is a case number that goes with the smithing button, but I don’t know it off the top of my head.

To open a menu/void with a command do this…

Put a void with your other public void’s.

public void theRune() {
sendMessage("The rune says hi o.O");
}

Next make a command with your other commands like this…

else if(command.StartsWith("rune")) {
theRune();
}

Read full topic

item.title: Smithing Help Menu!
item.dc:creator: @billysmither billysmither
item.description:
@billysmither wrote:

Spose you have already added this, if not add this below

public void smithingmenu() { sendQuest("Smithing Menu!", 8144); 

	public void smithingHelp()
	{
		sendQuest("@whi@Smithing Help!", 8144);
		clearQuestInterface();
		sendQuest("@bla@-Bronze Smithing Table-", 8147);
		sendQuest("@dbl@Lvl 1 Dagger, Axe.", 8148);
		sendQuest("@dbl@Lvl 2 Mace.", 8149);
		sendQuest("@dbl@Lvl 3 Medium Helm.", 8150);
		sendQuest("@dbl@Lvl 4 Sword, Nails, Dart Tips.", 8151);

		sendQuest("@dbl@Lvl 35 Scimitar, Arrow Heads.", 8190);

		flushOutStream();


ok then now to make a command so that players can open the menu

	else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("smithinghelp")) //command players will have to type 
	{
		smithingHelp();	//calls the public void (smithing menu)  
	}

[i]the command that Mrquarter posted will give you a “ERROR” and will not work the opnce above will work

add the command here
Search For
[/i]

[code] else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“mainmenu”))
{

	MainHelpMenu();	
} [/code]

smithingHelp()
}

item.title: Smithing Help Menu!
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

Here is the code you need to add.

if (command.startWith.IgnoreCase("smithinghelp")) { smithingHelp() }

Hope that helps.

-Mrquarter
